original: Berg, Åke Georg, kommendörkapten, Visby, f. 1/1/02 i Växjö av ing. Alfred B. o. Hulda Carlholm. G. 1. 29 m. Louise Lindmark; 2. 34 m. Britt Kjellberg. Barn: Nils f. 30, Marianne 36, Anders 38. — Stud:ex. 21, sjöoff :-ex. 24, KSHS stabskurs 31. Res. t. hamnstäder i Syd-Europa, Afrika o. Asien (Oistindien) 21-29, Ital. o. Frankr. 30 samt Schv^eiz. KommendÖTkapt. 43. Medl. av Timmermansorden 38. Skr.: art. i tidn. o. tidskr. Ho’bbdes : rid- o. vin-tersport,^ musik. RSO 44, OffTunNI 30, Sjövärnskårens GM 42, SvFMSM 39.
translated: Berg, Åke Georg, Commander Captain, Visby, born on January 1st, 1902 in Växjö to engineer Alfred B. and Hulda Carlholm. He was married twice: 1st in 1929 to Louise Lindmark and 2nd in 1934 to Britt Kjellberg. His children are Nils (born in 1930), Marianne (born in 1936), and Anders (born in 1938). He graduated from high school in 1921, became a naval officer in 1924, and completed a course in staff management at KSHS in 1931. He served in various ports in South Europe, Africa, and Asia (East Indies) from 1921 to 1929, in Italy and France in 1930, and in Switzerland. He became Commander Captain in 1943 and was a member of the Timberman's Order in 1938. He wrote articles in newspapers and magazines and was interested in horse riding, winter sports, music, and wine. He was awarded RSO in 1944, OffTunNI in 1930, Sjövärnskårens GM in 1942, and SvFMSM in 1939.

article.name: Various articles in newspapers and magazines
